title: Could the COVID19 crisis convince conservatives to trust in science? - Quora

response.answer_text: Conservatives do not place blind trust in anything. The belief is that it is our responsibility to be informed and educated, not to rely on others to tell us what to think. The Covid-19 sham has badly hurt the credibility of science. As has so many so called scientific papers conducted with extreme bias and using pseudo science to push an agenda. Remember the Nazis used the same science to prove the superiority of the German race. Science isn’t a judge, jury, arbitrator or even source of truth. Science is a tool to examine the world and find the truth. Science doesn’t answer questions, logical thinking enhanced with critical thought uses science to answer questions. Science is like statistics. You can prove anything scientifically. There isn’t much that I can think of that I couldn’t construct a scientific experiment and prove conclusively that my point of view was right, then take another point of view and prove it right using the same methods. The hilarious BMJ experiment that proved jumping out of an airplane with a parachute didn’t improve your chances of survival illustrated how so many people have a blind and religious faith in science. It also demonstrates how journalists can take a little piece of research and blow it up into something it isn’t and never was. You see this frequently with climate change scams. Seek knowledge, quit letting people and organizations lead you by the nose. Work at becoming an informed consumer of knowledge. Seek out conflicting viewpoints and examine them. Then as your skills grow place faith in your own abilities rather than others. When you are wrong and make mistakes, learn how to correct them without taking them personally. As for Covid19. The scientific community botched it so badly and the media blew up what they said into such gross exaggeration that the efforts to combat it will kill more than the disease has. Worse it has created an ongoing situation where we remained trapped in cycles of infection and lockdowns. All for political gain. The Left wants to break the economy as they see that as Trump’s strength. They don’t understand that people who taste freedom seek freedom. Just because their jobs went away doesn’t cause people to forget what it was like to have control of their life and be on the road to prosperity, instead of waiting on hand outs and blaming others for their misfortune. The only way we are getting through Covid-19 is through herd immunity. There is no magic cure or vaccine coming. It’s a virus and one that mutates rapidly. We haven’t been able to cure AIDS or Hep C despite intense efforts over the last 40 years. We haven’t developed a vaccine for the common cold (caused by a Corona virus in many cases). If we could, we’d done so as trillions of work hours are lost every year to the common cold and thousands die every year when those colds turn to pneumonia. Why would we think we could beat this meaner version of the common cold? IF we could develop a vaccine, it’d be a couple years from the day it was developed before mass vaccinations would occur and you’d be lucky to vaccinate 40% of the nation. 60% is an absolute tops. Even if you vaccinated 100%, there are 3 million Illegals crossing the border each year. At least 5% of them have Covid19. It’s not going away. Not by lockdowns or vaccinations. It’s a fact of life like H1N1 is. All we can do is develop herd immunity and try to find a way to protect the most vulnerable from diseases like H1N1 which killed some of the “Covid-19” casualties, the flu, Covid-19, and 100 other diseases that kill thousands each year. AIDS still kills over a million people every year world wide. TB is starting to rear it’s head again. There’s a lot of ways to die. If we develop herd immunity, then Covid19 just becomes yet another of the many risks people in the high risk category face. If we magically eliminated Covid19 from the world, they’d still die. Most of them were dying already when they contracted Covid. Covid just shaved 6–12 months off their life. Covid is not going away. Unless we seal our borders tight for the next few hundreds years, we can’t get rid of it. It’s going to come in from visitors, from Americans traveling abroad, from Illegals. At least we can test people entering the nation legally. We can’t test Illegals. Illegals will bring it back over and over and over again until we have herd immunity or shut down the borders. I don’t see the will to shut down the borders so herd immunity it is. These lockdowns advocated by “scientists” ignore these very basic facts.

There is a conceptual problem with this question. The assumption is that Conservatives don’t trust science, which on face value is absurd. I’m conservative and agree that evolution, germ theory and a host of other scientific posits are correct. The problem is when some claim a certain people with opposing ideology are somehow not scientifically literate as a cover or way to deflect criticism from their own viewpoints. Science is perverted for political gain, that is what most people understand and do not trust. People don’t trust people, and that is a learned behavior sadly enough.

Sure there are idiots who look at science as a dirty word. But they are largely illiterate parrots anyway and don’t understand anything about science. Conservatives are smart enough to understand science and that it works. But, there are some in the conservative movement that have found it useful to convince these gullible little pea brains that instead of listening to and trusting scientists, they should trust only Republicans and their army of soulless Goebbels wannabees on Fox News and Talk Radio.

It’s almost impossible to get conservatives (Right-Statists) or liberals (Left-Statists) to trust in science when it goes against their politics. And neither side has a monopoly on science denial for this reason. When politics and science clash, a statist will always choose politics. And science clashes hard with both positions— just on different topics.

No way. Evidently you get your news from somewhere other than Fox News, which is all about not trusting in science. Spend a few hours watching Fox News and you’ll realize that they’re using the COVID-19 crisis to strengthen conservatives’ distrust of science.

For some, sure. For others, unlikely. Trust in science is not about being — or not being — conservative. Conservatism is not a proxy for not trusting science. I suspect it’s got more do with levels of education and the KIND of education one is exposed to. And that’s neither conservative or liberal.

An article from National Review OL just theorized that COVID-19 was a Chinese bio-weapon (“China Wants to Use the Coronavirus to Take Over the World” 4–03–20), so no, conservatives are quite immune to any contradiction.
Conservatives do trust science. They just don’t trust the politicized version the left likes.
